document_data.name: Wengwater
document_data.mainbody: The '''Wengwater''' was a tributary of [[Lake Weng]] in [[Amn]].
document_data.Description: The river was fast and had dangerous rapids. Each year, it flooded, which left small ponds north of the town of [[Amnwater]].
document_data.Geography: The Wengwater began in the [[Cloud Peaks]] and flowed past Amnwater until it poured into Lake Weng from the east.
document_data.History: Every few years, someone tried to run the rapids of the Wengwater in a feat of daring, but as of [[1370 DR]], no one in 300 years had successfully navigated them.
